text: John Robert McRay (17 December 1931 - 24 August 2018) was an archaeologist, and professor emeritus of New Testament at Wheaton College (Illinois). He supervised excavating teams in the Holy Land: Caesarea, Sepphoris, and Herodium. He also was an expert in the languages, cultures, geography, and history of Israel-Palestine. == Notable Works == * * * == References == Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:University of Chicago alumni
title: John McRay
